company.name: Hayden Claims Group
company.tagline: Mother Nature isn't fair but insurance should be
company.report_header: Hayden Claims Group - Professional Storm Damage Assessment

key_findings: Significant hail event reported within ~1.5 miles of property on 2025-03-23 (2.5 in) — high probability of roof/shingle damage
Prior local hail reports (2024-05-13) and measured wind gusts (45 mph on 2024-01-08) increase cumulative wear and risk
Property is older (1978) with asphalt shingle roof — moderate vulnerability to large-diameter hail and wind-driven damage
critical_actions: Schedule full roof and exterior inspection (photographic + moisture scan) within 7 days
Document current damage (photos, video, date/time-stamped) and secure temporary tarping if exposure found
Notify insurer and preserve receipts/estimates; retain Hayden Claims Group to manage carrier communications
executive_summary.hayden_advantage: Hayden combines local Kerrville storm-forensics (event-matching + measured hail reports), contractor network for timely emergency repairs, and public adjuster expertise to maximize settlement and speed claims.

storm_risk_summary.title: Local Storm Event Summary
storm_risk_summary.subtitle: Events within 15 miles affecting claim likelihood
insights: Primary high-risk hail strike on 2025-03-23 close to property
Repeat smaller hail events indicate cumulative roof degradation

property_damage_assessment.title: Preliminary Property Vulnerability
property_damage_assessment.subtitle: Target systems and likely damage
rows: Partial to full roof replacement or overlay
AC fan/coil repair or replacement estimate
insights: Roof is primary loss exposure; large-diameter hail (>2 in) typically causes bruising and shingle failure
Secondary exposures: vents, flashing, gutters, aluminum components

repair_cost_analysis.title: Estimated Repair & Replacement Costs (Kerrville, TX market)
repair_cost_analysis.subtitle: Realistic cost bands for present condition
insights: Full roof replacement is the cost driver; presence of hail >2" often justifies full replacement for insurer settlement
Emergency tarping and minor repairs typically <$3k

insurance_claim_strategy.title: Claim Strategy & Tactics
insurance_claim_strategy.subtitle: Maximize recovery while minimizing delays
rows: Photographic, infrared moisture scan, Xactimate line-item inventory
Prepare timeline, attach storm evidence and public reports
Draft & submit to insurer; manage communications
Obtain contractor bids, track supplements for uncovered items
Negotiate scope and supplements with insurer
Demand package with comparable market pricing
Advocate and, if needed, appeal/UM mediation
insights: Hayden files evidence-matched claim (event reports + geolocated hail) to overcome initial low-paid offers
Use multiple contractor bids and industry line items (Xactimate) to avoid underpayment

contractor_market_intelligence.title: Local Contractor Market Snapshot
contractor_market_intelligence.subtitle: Availability & fair pricing in Kerr County
rows: 2–4 weeks scheduling for non-emergency; 48–72 hrs for tarping
Local roofers active post-storm; verify licensing & lien waivers
AC techs limited in peak season; expedite for safety/claim
insights: Secure emergency tarping quickly; obtain signed scopes before work to protect owner

risk_mitigation_plan.title: Short- and Medium-Term Mitigation
risk_mitigation_plan.subtitle: Reduce immediate exposure and strengthen claim position
rows: Identify active leaks or hidden damage
insights: Timely emergency measures preserve habitability and strengthen insurer obligation to pay permanent repairs

immediate_actions: Do not operate HVAC until unit inspected; photograph outdoor unit
Conduct full roof walk/inspection with safety harness (Hayden-arranged)
Apply temporary tarping to any visible penetrations/leaks

next_steps.action: Schedule full visual + infrared roof inspection
Document claim and submit Notice of Loss to insurer
Secure emergency tarping if any breaches found

inspections.purpose: Identify hail dents and trim damage

documentation: Roof measurement, shingle type, serial/age if available
Contractor bids in Xactimate line-item format
Receipts for emergency repairs and temporary housing if used
recommendations.insurance_timeline: File claim within 7-14 days of inspection; expect 30-90 day resolution timeline
recommendations.hayden_coordination: Hayden Claims Group can coordinate all recommended inspections and contractor services

hayden_value.value_proposition: Hayden Claims Group provides specialized storm damage expertise, local contractor coordination, and insurance negotiation skills that maximize your claim settlement while minimizing stress and delays.
competitive_advantages: Local Kerrville storm intelligence and forensic event matching
Established contractor network for emergency and permanent repairs
Proven insurance negotiation tactics using Xactimate industry standards
No upfront costs - we only get paid when you do
Average claim increase of 30-50% vs. initial insurer offers
hayden_value.potential_savings: $5,000 - $15,000 in additional claim recovery and contractor negotiation
hayden_value.risk_without_help: Substantial risk of claim underpayment (average 40%), delayed settlements, and missed damage documentation

cumulative_factors: Aging asphalt shingles (1978 construction) — likely multiple overlay cycles since original
Mature trees near structure increase risk of branch/impact damage
Multiple independent local hail reports, including very large (2.5 in), increase insurer damage-likelihood scoring

metadata.analysis_methodology: Comprehensive multi-source storm data analysis combining NOAA reports, local CoCoRaHS observations, and property-specific vulnerability assessment
limitations: Analysis based on available public storm reports - actual property damage requires physical inspection
Cost estimates reflect current market conditions and may vary based on contractor availability
Insurance claim outcomes depend on policy terms and carrier practices
metadata.update_recommendation: Annual review recommended, or immediately following any new storm event
